bug.author: leela-uppuluri
bug.summary: Cannot access kubeflow dashboard as admin
bug.description:
What steps did you take and what happened: I have deployed the kubeflow installation on open source kubernetes cluster and also by default my profile owns a kubernetes namespace of the same name along with a collection of kubernetes resources. After setting up the Istio load balancer and configuring the node port forwarding for the istio-ingressgateway I could able to access a fresh kubeflow dashboard which asks me to create namespace for my account but I already have namespaces available of my k8s cluster with kubeflow and my name. I still did create one using kubeflow dashboard UI and able to direct into the homepage but I see only one namespace and not as an admin. What did you expect to happen: I should be able to access kubeflow dashboard as an admin and should be able to manage all the contributors. Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): build version dev_local kfctl version: (use kfctl version): v1.0.1 Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube): open source k8s Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): v1.15 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS
